I am sorry, but there is no information about a magical ambiance at this hotel. The hotel has generally small rooms and is in an older building, but has been recently renovated and is clean, offered at a reasonable price.

Hotel 57 is a sleek and modern boutique hotel with a European feel and a chic, intimate ambiance, featuring a hopping bar/restaurant. Some rooms have terraces, and the hotel has undergone recent renovations to create a modern organic aesthetic.
The Renaissance New York Hotel Times Square is located in the heart of Times Square. Some reviewers find the hotel decor to be modern/futuristic, funky, or space-age.

Located near Bryant Park, the Residence Inn offers spectacular views of the Empire State Building from the upper floors, especially from corner rooms and some rooms even have a view of the Empire State Building from the window. The hotel's 3rd floor lounge is decorated with cozy seating areas and has a library-like atmosphere.

The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park offers harbor view rooms with telescopes, a bar with views of the Statue of Liberty, and a location near Battery Park and the waterfront. Some guests found the hotel quiet and elegant, with a romantic atmosphere and a tranquil location away from the hustle and bustle of midtown.

The Roger Smith Hotel is described as a charming and unique boutique hotel with unique decor in each room, an artsy feel, live plants, books, and rotating art exhibits. The hotel has a cozy, homey atmosphere and a quirky, older feel.

The Roger Williams Hotel is described as trendy, boutique hotel with a modern, sleek decor, a stylish lobby, and brightly colored rooms. Some reviewers describe the lobby as gorgeous, a hidden gem, and well-lit with candles at night creating a cozy atmosphere.

This hotel has a dim heated pool area with soothing music, swim-up bar, twinkly lights, neon orange lighting and steam and sauna rooms, and parties with DJs. The hotel has a dim or low lighting throughout, wavy black and white zebra lines in the hallways, and rooms with massive numbers on the doors.

The Royalton Hotel features a dark and moody ambiance with dimmed lighting, candles, and a fireplace in the lobby, creating a romantic and intimate atmosphere. Some rooms offer fireplaces and large soaking tubs, enhancing the hotel's unique and stylish feel.

The Salisbury Hotel has an old charm and character with an old-fashioned decor, and was built in 1939; some reviewers mentioned it was opposite Carnegie Hall & the Russian tea rooms. It has been described as quirky, not contemporary, and old-fashioned.

The San Carlos Hotel has staff who are exceptionally welcoming and friendly, and one reviewer mentioned Gabriel who greeted them with a magic trick upon arrival. The owner also introduced himself and was absolutely delightful.

This hotel has a stylish lobby, a lobby bar with a lively atmosphere, a club floor bar, and offers Times Square views. There are occasional mentions of long lines and elevator waits.
The lobby has holiday decorations that make it sparkle, and the hotel has an art deco feel. The pool is on the 10th floor and has skyline views.
The Smyth Tribeca is a modern boutique hotel with trendy decor, custom-made chrome-accented furniture, and a Yabu Pushelberg-designed lobby with cozy nooks. Some reviewers mention a darker vibe.

The Sofitel New York has a romantic, 1930s feel and European ambiance, with a lobby featuring a fire that seems to be always lit. The lobby is filled with fresh flowers and scented candles, and classical music plays in the rooms.

The Soho Grand is a stylish hotel with a sophisticated ambiance, dimly lit interiors, a cool lobby bar, and common spaces that are still beautiful. As a grand guest, you may even get a goldfish for company.

Soho House New York has spacious and individually decorated rooms with vintage furniture, great sound systems, and oversized freestanding bathtubs. The hotel also has a rooftop pool and bar with views and a games room.
The Stay Hotel has a trendy lobby with funky lights and a large fish tank. Aspen Social Club is a bar/lounge in the hotel with a lodge-like theme.

The Alex Hotel is described as having a modern, minimalist, and sleek design with a boutique feel and Breathtaking views of the Chrysler building. The hotel also has modern luxury amenities like flat screen televisions in the bathroom.

The Belvedere Hotel has an art deco style lobby, is described as a gem of a hotel snuggled in the heart of Theatre-land, and has a warm and friendly atmosphere. Some reviewers mentioned a "quirky" or "unique" ambiance.

The Benjamin has a Beaux Arts style lobby with classical music playing and offers a pillow concierge with a menu of 12 different pillow types. Rooms have amenities like a Bose radio, Elemis products, and the hotel offered turndown service.

The Blakely Hotel has an old-world feel with dark wood features, and is described as a small boutique hotel with a cozy lobby and European-style sofas. Some reviewers found it intimate, friendly, and like "coming home".

The Bowery Hotel has a vintage, old-world charm with decor featuring wooden panelled walls, age-darkened mirrors, subdued lighting, and a stone fireplace. The lobby and bar have a gothic feel, and the outdoor patio overlooks an enclosed garden.

The Bryant Park Hotel is described as super swank and modern, with magical views of the Bryant Park ice-skating rink in winter. It has a swank, red lobby, dimly lit elevators, and rainforest/stream/bird/thunderstorm sounds playing bedside.

The Carlton has a grand and atmospheric lobby, elegant rooms with classic finishing and Molton Brown bath products, and corridors that some guests describe as "creepy" or "Ghost-busters looking". Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

The Carlyle has a lobby that takes on a mystical and magical feeling in the evening with soft lighting and beautiful chandeliers, with Bemelman's Bar having drawings on the wall of Madeline's journies through Central Park. The hotel is known for its old-world charm, classic atmosphere, and often has live jazz music.

The Franklin Hotel is described as a charming boutique hotel with a European feel, featuring a crystal chandelier in some rooms and antique decor in common areas. The hotel offers a complimentary wine and cheese in the evening that enhances the romantic and charming feel of the hotel.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments has a New Orleans-themed decor and is described as having a warm, welcoming feel with elegant, beautifully decorated rooms. The hotel is also connected to Bourbon Street bar.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea has a modern, clean, and stylish boutique ambiance with spotlit orchids on the upper floors. It is described as funky and artsy with European-style rooms and a red, black, and grey color scheme.

The Helmsley Carlton House Hotel, located one block from Central Park, features spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes or balconies overlooking Central Park. The hotel aims to provide an exclusive, penthouse-like feel with a beautifully decorated lobby.

The Helmsley Park Lane offers a great location across from Central Park, with some rooms providing spectacular views, especially from higher floors. The hotel is noted for its classic charm and old-fashioned elegance, although some find the decor dated and in need of refurbishment.

The Herald Square Hotel, formerly the Life Magazine building, features art gallery-like walls with art and photographs and has a cherub over the door. Some guests describe renovated rooms with period hardware, immaculate bathrooms, and comfortable beds, while others mention the availability of an art gallery on the walls.
Hotel 91 is located in the heart of Chinatown, offering a culturally diverse experience. Some reviewers mention the hotel has Asian accents, is near Buddhist temples, and is close to fortune tellers.
This hotel is located in the heart of Midtown Manhattan, close to Times Square and other attractions. The hotel rooms have been recently renovated with modern decor, flat screen TVs, and iPod docks.

The Inn at Irving Place has authentic 19th-century decor and is described as a hidden treasure that feels like stepping into another world. It features parlors with working fireplaces and offers tea service in an opulent, sun-drenched dining room.

The Iroquois Hotel is a small, elegant boutique hotel with classy decor and classic furnishings, located in a quiet area close to Times Square, offering a cozy ambiance. The hotel has elegant rooms with high-quality amenities and a comfortable library.

The Jane Hotel has a vintage vibe with a manually operated elevator and cabin-like rooms reminiscent of a ship, with some reviewers describing it as being like the Titanic or Darjeeling Limited. The hotel is over a hundred years old and sheltered Titanic survivors.
The Kimberly Hotel has classic NYC hotel decor, some rooms are regal, with ornate furnishings, and is known for its amazing beds. Some rooms have balconies with city views.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel where each room is individually owned and decorated with different themes, creating a unique experience with custom or semi-custom design. Some reviewers describe the hotel as having an elegant, classy atmosphere.

The hotel's restaurant and bar scene is lively with a trendy crowd, has a lobby that always has a sense of life to it, and offers afternoon tea. One reviewer felt like they were in London rather than New York while inside the hotel.

The Lucerne is described as having a "faded elegance," "charming decor," and being "traditionally decorated," with a balance between old and new. Reviews mention its traditionally decorated lobby and hallways, as well as furnishings that are tastefully decorated.

The Mansfield Hotel has a Gentleman's club feel with a book-lined library and leather chairs, and a reading room with a fireplace and tall wooden bookcases and cozy chairs that create a luxurious and comforting ambiance. Some found it charming with marble floors, narrow hallways, and winding steep staircases, but others found it shabby with old furniture and dim lighting.

The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern, trendy hotel with a funky decor, sometimes described as minimalist or "boutique style," with some rooms offering views of the Empire State Building and rooftop terraces. The lobby features a fireplace, and there's a lounge on the 10th floor.

The Maritime Hotel has a nautical theme, with rooms designed like ship cabins featuring porthole windows and navy hallways. The hotel is known for its hip, retro lobby with a fireplace, sleek decor, and dim lighting, which creates a unique and relaxing ambiance.
The Mark is located on the Upper East Side, near museums, art galleries, and Central Park. Some rooms have modern designs with remote-controlled shades and TVs in the bathroom mirrors.

The Marmara Manhattan is located in the Upper East Side, in a residential area, with spacious apartment-style rooms that include full kitchens. Some reviewers mention city views from higher floors, a museum-quality lobby, and a chandelier in the lift.
The hotel has vibrant colors of red and balloons in the lobby, and the decor is chic, stylish and vibrant. The hotel shines with light, unlike most hotels with dark furnishings.

The Mercer has a chic, understated boutique style with a lobby that feels like a comfortable living room, often frequented by celebrities. The hotel provides unique touches such as lit candles at turn down and access to a DVD and CD library.

The Michelangelo Hotel has a beautiful lobby with a serene European atmosphere and is ornately decorated with classical paintings, chandeliers, and pink marble floors. The hotel ambiance is described as a haven with a calming, elegant comfort and an old-world Italian feel, with classical music playing.

The Muse Hotel has a trendy, modern, and creative ambiance with a fashion-forward lobby, art deco themed rooms, and beautiful bathrooms. Some guests found it to have a "calm oasis" feel despite being steps from Times Square.

The hotel has an impressive lobby, and some rooms have views of the Chrysler and Empire State buildings, especially those on the higher floors. There are red carpets, brass-embellished elevators, and globe lightbulbs.
The New Yorker Hotel has art deco styling and has been recently refurbished. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler building.

The Pierre is described as having "old-world charm" with architectural details like a functional mail chute, expansive marble lobby, and crown moldings. Some reviewers mention feeling transported to a different time with a grand and elegant atmosphere.

The Plaza Hotel is described as a landmark property with old-world charm, grandeur, and luxurious decor, featuring opulent bathrooms with mosaic tiles and gold-plated fixtures. Some reviewers mention a "fairytale of New York experience" and a sense of being transported to "paradise."
The Pod Hotel has a funky, hip atmosphere with cozy and welcoming decor, music playing in the hallways and bathrooms, and art on the walls. It has a roof garden with city views and an outdoor patio.
The Premier is described as a "hidden gem" and a "haven of peace and quiet" despite being located in Times Square. Some rooms offer views of the Chrysler Building and the Paramount Clock.

The Ritz Carlton Central Park has a magical ambiance, with stunning views of Central Park from park-view rooms, and is known for high standards of service and attention to detail. Select rooms feature telescopes for observing Central Park, and a VIP pass is available for the Empire State Building.

The Roosevelt Hotel has a grand lobby with a beautiful Christmas tree and is a historic hotel reminiscent of pre-war grandeur. Its lobby is a gem and the hotel has an elegant and classic old New York charm.

The Sherry-Netherland is a small, intimate hotel with individually owned and furnished rooms, offering a luxurious and opulent apartment-like experience. It features hand-painted elevators with medieval-style art, fresh flowers, chocolates, and a serene atmosphere, providing a tranquil escape from the city.

The Shoreham Hotel is a modern, stylish, and trendy boutique hotel with minimalist decor, Aveda bath products, a free coffee bar, and a bar/restaurant. It is located in midtown Manhattan, close to shopping, museums, and Central Park, but some rooms are small and have limited views.

The St. Regis has spacious rooms with opulent Victorian fashion decor, marble bathrooms, and a lobby that is small yet gorgeous. It is an old-world, traditional luxury accommodation with beautiful furniture, elegant public areas, and polite and cultured staff.

The Standard has fantastic views of the city, and is known for its innovative dcor, dreamlike elevator video, and floor-to-ceiling windows. There's "something magical" about the hotel and it has a "fun" atmosphere.
The hotel is located near Central Park, close to the Alice in Wonderland statue, and is described as a "fabulous little gem". The rooms have small touches like hand-painted decals on the armoire.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical neighborhood on Sylvan Terrace, near the Jumel Mansion, the oldest house in Manhattan. The house is described as having a charming deck and beautiful African art decorations.

The Time Hotel has a modern, trendy, and sometimes funky atmosphere with a bar/lounge that can be buzzing with Yuppies or have a club-like feeling with loud music. Some reviewers found the hotel's design and color schemes, like the red, blue, and yellow rooms, to be lovely, retro, warm, and cozy.

The Waldorf Astoria is described as a beautiful, impressive hotel with old-world elegance and charm, a step back in time to an era of luxury and style. The lobby has art deco detailing, beautiful floors and ceilings, and interesting pictures, contributing to its historic ambiance.

The Westin New York at Times Square has a modern mid-century revival style decor, and the hotel captures a tranquil, calming oasis from the noise of the city. This hotel is decorated for Christmas and many rooms offer views of the Hudson River.

Some reviewers describe the lobby as having an industrial feel, a hip, minimalist design, and a trendy reception area; decor is described as sleek, neutral, neutral, and minimalist. Some reviewers mention there is a bar/restaurant attached and several restaurants nearby, with some offering magical ambiance.

The Thompson LES features modern and sleek decor, sometimes described as minimalist, with floor-to-ceiling windows that offer city views. Some rooms have unique design elements such as concrete ceilings and frosted glass in the bathroom.
This hotel has a large outdoor pool on the third floor surrounded by a patio with cafe tables and a terrace garden. Some rooms have a view of the pool and the Empire State Building.

The Tribeca Grand is a trendy, stylish hotel with a soaring atrium lobby where a kicking party is usually happening at the bar on weekends. The hotel has subdued lighting and excellent furnishings, and the decor is a cross between futuristic and factory environments.
The Trump International Hotel and Tower has views overlooking Central Park. Rooms offer luxurious amenities such as jacuzzi tubs, chocolates, and high-end bath products.

The Tudor Hotel is described as charming, historic, and quaint, with a Tudor City neighborhood location that includes quiet parks and views of the East River. Some reviewers enjoyed the hotel's historic building and recent renovations, while others found it old, run down, and pretentious.

The Avalon, now Vincci Avalon, is a small, clean, and comfortable hotel with European character, some rooms are Opulent Executive Suites, or Junior suites with two double beds, others are clean and spacious but a bit dated. It is in a central location near the Empire State Building, some rooms have views of it, and it is well-situated for shopping and accessing other parts of Manhattan via subway.

W New York - The Court has a hip lobby with techno music and a bar that creates a fun atmosphere; some guests describe it as trendy and club-like, while others find it dark and noisy. The hotel is decorated in a contemporary style, but some guests find the rooms worn and the lighting dim.
The W Tuscany is a trendy and modern hotel with a chic but quiet ambiance, with bar that is busy at night. Some reviewers have described the hotel as dark.

The W Times Square is a trendy and modern hotel with a waterfall entrance and a lively lobby bar that turns into a nightclub at night. Some reviewers describe the ambiance as cool, hip, and sleek, while others find it dark and noisy.

The hotel has a modern and stylish decor, with a cool and hip vibe, and a lobby bar that attracts a trendy crowd. It has a living room bar, an Underbar club in the basement, and the restaurant, Olives.

The Waldorf Towers, connected to the Waldorf Astoria, offers old-world elegance, spacious suites with art deco details, and a private entrance, and is located in midtown Manhattan near many attractions. Some reviewers mention feeling like royalty due to the service and opulent surroundings.

The Wall Street Inn is a small, quiet boutique hotel with a charming mix of colonial and turn-of-the-(20th)century era design, located on a quaint street in the Financial District. Some rooms have jacuzzi baths and sitting areas, and the hotel backs onto a small street with a number of restaurants.

The Warwick is a historic hotel with some art deco-style rooms, an old-world ambiance, and a restaurant with murals. It is located in midtown within walking distance of Central Park and the theater district.
This hotel does not have a magical ambiance; many guests describe the rooms as small. Some guests reported a fresh rose in the room upon arrival.

The Washington Square Hotel is described as a charming, boutique hotel with Art Deco touches and a unique atmosphere, decorated with black and white photos of movie stars. The hotel has a jazz vibe and is located in Greenwich Village, next to Washington Square.
The Wellington Hotel is described as old-fashioned with art deco lobbies. The dated decor adds to the charm for some visitors.

The hotel features modern decor, a terrace on the 25th floor with night light views, and rooms with technological enhancements. Some bathrooms have glass shower stalls open to the bedroom with floor-to-ceiling windows.

I am sorry, but the reviews for this hotel do not contain information about a magical ambiance. The hotel is well-located, clean, modern, and offers a complimentary breakfast, fitness center, and internet.

The Wolcott Hotel is a 100-year-old historic building with a beautiful Beaux-Arts lobby that evokes a pre-war New York ambiance. The hotel features a ballroom, and some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

I am sorry, but none of the reviews mention any information about a magical ambiance. The reviews mention this is more like an apartment, not a hotel with no service. It is conveniently located near the subway, Central Park, shops and restaurants.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel features a stylish lobby with transforming ambient lighting and hip artwork, and a "Greenhouse" restaurant which has an all-glass design. A 10th-floor outdoor bar with a great view is also available.
